column4: i have windows installed on c drive and i want to install ubuntu on c drive i also want to keep windows recovery but i am worried that later on when i do the recovery my ubuntu will be lost
the recovery is usually just a hidden partition.  Just make sure to leave that partition alone when partitioning
ok, listen to this, ignore everything else that you have been told
just shrink your windows partition, and install ubuntu to the leftover space

yeah, so if your recovery can be invoked from the bios (ie, the first screen that shows up when you boot), then your recovery is just a hidden partition.  I would suggest these steps.  Defrag your windows drive.  Boot the livecd, and shrink the windows partition.  Create a new partition (at least 20g), format as ext3 and a mount point of /      Then click continue.  You should be ok.
i want to ask when i will be doing recovery will my ubuntu on c drive will be lost or not as i want to keep only recovery of windows
are you saying you want to delete window completely, save the recovery option?
I'd start with a dual boot first.   Just to be safe.
i have installed ubuntu already but i want to ask when i will be doing recovery will  the windows will be installed on c drive or not
no, AFAIK, it will delete ubuntu
